values: All students in preschool through sixth grade required to wear masks indoors. Students in grades 7-12 "strongly encouraged" to wear masks. All staff will wear masks indoors. More information
"allow local school leaders to determine their masking policies"
The Archdiocese has 35 schools in nine counties. It said local school leaders will decide on a mask policy and will follow local health guidance. Check with your specific school for their policy.

All students in child development centers, elementary and preschool-8th grade schools required to wear masks. Masks strongly encouraged for all students at middle and high schools. Unvaccinated staff required to wear masks, vaccinated staff strongly encouraged to wear masks. More information
county health department said required as of 8/9

The Boulder County Public Health Department will require all students ages 2 and up as well as teachers and staff in the school district to wear masks when inside a building, regardless of vaccination status. More information
Optional/not required  7/27 -- Fully vaccinated people can go without masks in 27J Schools and properties.
Masks are recommended but not required for unvaccinated students or adults over the age of 12. More information

Masks required inside school buildings for all pre-kindergarten through sixth grade students and staff who work with that age group. Other students and staff are "strongly encouraged" to wear a mask, but are not required to. More information
Face masks are optional, but encouraged for the unvaccinated. More information
no decision 7/22 ... they have 400+ students, not 500
Students, teachers, school staff and visitors are required to wear masks regardless of vaccination status, effective Aug. 9. More information
Optional/not required   7/27 -- 11 and under - face coverings are strongly encouraged while learning indoors, but are not required

For students 11 and younger, masks are strongly encouraged while indoors, but are not required. For students 12 and older, masks are strongly encouraged for anyone not fully vaccinated, but not required. Staff also have the choice when it comes to masks.More information
not required/optional ... "they are optional for those who feel more comfortable wearing them."
The school says masks are "optional for those who feel more comfortable wearing them."
no decision 7/22 ... waiting for archdiocese decision, they're part of it.
masks required  ... (may change by the time school starts)

Masks are required inside all schools, child care settings and district buildings for those 2 and older, regardless of vaccination status. The order applies to students, staff, visitors and volunteers. More information
The school is going to start the year with masks for all students, teachers and staff when indoors.
optional/not required ... 7/27 -- D38 is presently planning to operate mask-optional for students on school grounds.
People may choose to wear a mask based on state guidance. More information
optional/not required 7/28, updated for 8/12 with required for unvaxxed teachers, staff & all visitors regardless of vax status

Masks are recommended, but not required, for all students and vaccinated teachers and staff. Unvaccinated teachers are staff, as well as all visitors regardless of vaccination status, must wear a mask as of Aug. 12. The same is true of all spectators at indoor sports and activities. More information

Optional/not required   7/27 -- At this time, masks are strongly encouraged for those who are not yet vaccinated and for those who are simply more comfortable with that extra layer of protection.  ... However, masks are required for anyone riding a school bus.
Masks are encouraged for students who have not been vaccinated. All employees are required to be fully vaccinated or wear a mask when indoors. More information

optional/not required in classroom/building, but kids in buses must wear them as long as it's a public transportation requirement. ... "encourage those who are not vaccinated to wear a mask ... or for those who wish to wear them as an additional layer of protection"
Masks are encouraged for those who have not been vaccinated.
Masks are required for all students and staff, no matter the vaccination status. More information
All students in grades preschool-12 are required to wear masks while inside school buildings, regardless of vaccination status. More information
Masks are optional for students and staff. More information
Required 8/2 -- Face masks will be required indoors for all students and staff, regardless of vaccine status
All students, teachers and staff are required to wear masks indoors. More information
